edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.core.datastructures

Class Lexicon

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.core.datastructures.Lexicon

  • public class Lexicon
extends Object
    A lexicon manager that manages features.
    Author:
    Vivek Srikumar

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lexicon

        public Lexicon(boolean hasBias,
               boolean storeStrings)
        Create a new lexicon object
        Parameters:
        hasBias - Include a default entry in the lexicon for GLOBAL_BIAS?
        storeStrings - Store strings in the lexicon? Useful for debugging at the expense of much more memory consumption

      • Lexicon

        public Lexicon(InputStream in)
        throws IOException
        Load a lexicon from the inputstream. This does not load the strings into the lexicon, even if they are present.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Lexicon

        public Lexicon(InputStream in,
               boolean loadStrings)
        throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • lookupId

        public int lookupId(String featureName)
        Get the internal id for this feature

      • lookupName

        public String lookupName(int id)
        Get the feature corresponding to the name. Note: This function will throw a NullPointerException if the lexicon is not explicitly asked to keep the feature strings in memory. The default is not to keep strings in memory.

      • countFeature

        public void countFeature(int featureId)
        Increment the count for featureId.

      • previewFeature

        public void previewFeature(String f)
        Add a new feature to this lexicon

      • contains

        public boolean contains(String f)

      • size

        public int size()
        The number of features in this lexicon

      • getFeatureHash

        protected int getFeatureHash(String featureName)
        A hash function from feature names to integers. The lexicon will lose features whenever there is a hash collision because it does not keep track of any of the strings.

      • getFeatureVector

        public Pair<int[],float[]> getFeatureVector(Map<String,Float> featureMap)

      • pruneFeaturesByCount

        public Pair<int[],float[]> pruneFeaturesByCount(int[] idx,
                                                float[] fs,
                                                int threshold)

      • save

        public void save(String file)
          throws IOException
        Saves the feature to id mapping. Note: This does not store the feature names.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getPrunedLexicon

        public Lexicon getPrunedLexicon(int threshold)
        prunes the lexicon by removing features with less than threshold many counts
